result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco T Smith

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered signature bond previously set to remain.

Court ordered NO CONTACT with LC, CJK, and MSK.  NO POSSESSION of dangerous weapons or firearms.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Marco T Smith in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Marco T Smith.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  It is the opinion of Doctor Jenna Goebel that Mr. Smith is competent to proceed.  Parties do not contest the Doctor's findings.  Court adopts the findings and schedules the matter for a preliminary hearing.  Court ordered signature bond previously set to remain.  However, bond conditions modified.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Competency Report Dated 10/26/22

Defendant Marco T Smith in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Marco T Smith.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a return on doctors report, evaluation has not been completed. Defendant does not qualify for out-patient program. State is requesting defendant be taken into custody for the evaluation. Defense is requesting defendant remain out of custody and be reevaluated. Court orders defendant to contact the forensic unit to schedule reevaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Warrant Request Letter 971.14(5)
SMITH Competency Evaluation.  Received and Filed.  nk
Outpatient Competency Admission Decision
Outpatient Competency Admission Decision, filed
signed, Order of Commitment for Treatment

Defendant Marco T Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case set for Hearing. Contested competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn: Dr. Goebel. Court finds defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to become competent.  Court does not order the involuntary administration of medication(s) and treatment. Court suspends proceedings. Court adjourns matter for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Marco T Smith in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask (both appear in person).  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears via Zoom video).
Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.
Defense counsel is requesting case be adjourned for competency hearing.
Statements to the Court by defendant
Defense counsel waives time limits

Court orders case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 2.

Forensics contacted during the hearing to confirm Dr's availability for the hearing.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Marco T Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Competency evaluation is scheduled with Dr. Jenna Goebel on 04/26/2022 @ 10:00am in room 504SB.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Court ordered case is adjourned for Return on Doctors Report in Br. 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marco T Smith in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Joseph Domask, present in court via Zoom, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 05-01-2022 and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marco T Smith in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LC, CJK, MSK.

Defendant Marco T Smith in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. No plea is entered as to the misdemeanor counts.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defendant stated to the court that he has retained attorney Joe Domask. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
